intro: Lasiostelma somalense, commonly known as the Somali star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue, which bloom during the rainy season. It is adapted to survive in dry, sandy soils and can tolerate periods of drought. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its ecosystem.
